item.title: Almost fixed
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

the DialogueHandler class sup[/sup] handles the dialogues themselves.
by creatingcase dialogue_id: sendOption2("Donator Weaponry", "Donator hats, masks, & partyhats"); c.dialogueAction = some_number_for_dialogue_action; break;you have created the dialogue situation, but never called it out.
now, you can go to ActionHandler class sup[/sup] and look for the methodfirstClickObject(int, int, int)now this method is where we will actually call upon the dialogue.

under the switch blockswitch(objectType);we are going to add the following code.case your_open_wardrobe_id: c.getDH().sendDialogues(dialogue_id_we_made_earlier, npc_id_to_talk); break;now to make these codes work when you click ‘Line 1’, ‘Line 2’, or ‘Line 3’;
we go on into ClickingButtons class sup[/sup]and we look for the switch blockswitch (actionButtonId)this will handle the actions for clicking each line.
we need to find case case 9157:in there, we will add the actions for the first line (donator weaponry) we can do that like soif (c.dialogueAction == some_number_for_dialogue_action) { c.getShops().openShop(DONATOR_WEAPONRY_SHOP_ID); }now we look for case case 9158:in there, we will add the actions for the second line (donator hats, masks, & partyhats) we can do that like soif (c.dialogueAction == some_number_for_dialogue_action) { c.getShops().openShop(DONATOR_HATS_MASKS_PHATS_SHOP_ID); }

there. i spoonfed you enough. and i swear to god if you ask one more question about it i will kill you.

Read full topic

item.title: Almost fixed
item.dc:creator: @Bhpk Bhpk
item.description:
@Bhpk wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:43, topic:520943”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=639451.msg4310021#msg4310021 date=1370584141]
It’s not c.sendOption3(params)
Dialogue is handled in the DailogueHandler class, therefore we must reference that class; not client. There is a constructor already made getDialogues(); (I believe)
[/quote]
I realized my mistake and told him to remove the c. lol.
idk if he fixed it.[/quote]I removed the “c” no errors, but It’s doesn’t show me in-game ( Not working )

Look, if you got teamviewer you can help me via it, If you have tell me,

item.title: Almost fixed
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

It’s not c.sendOption3(params)
Dialogue is handled in the DailogueHandler class, therefore we must reference that class; not client. There is a constructor already made getDialogues(); (I believe)

item.title: Almost fixed
item.dc:creator: @bob2568 bob2568
item.description:
@bob2568 wrote:

Dude, moparscape is not a place where everyone spoon feeds you exactly what you want/need you have to have some kind of knowledge if your ever going to successfully code, there is nothing wrong with asking for help, but if your going 2, try fixing it yourself before seeking assistance, these guys are giving you the tools to fix it, yet you give up because you say " I don’t know how " yet you say your players are waiting for you, if you really have a server then I apologize to all of your players because if you don’t even know how dialoguehandler works, then your server probably isn’t going to last awhile.

[code=java]

c.sendOption3(“option1”, “Option2”, “Option3”);
break;
